result.execSummary:
The defendant Jerome N. RUSSELL was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • 2nd Degree Sexual Assault/Use of Force, a class C felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.225(2)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Consecutive to sentence defendant is serving in 96 CF 131.

superMiscConds.notes: If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

Pay supervision fees in an amount to be determined by the Department of Corrections.

Defendant shall not ingest any drugs or alcohol (maintain absolute sobriety).

Defendant shall submit to random drug screens and pay for same.

Defendant shall not enter into any taverns or bars, nor shall he work in any establishment that serves alcohol.

Defendant will not be in possession of any controlled substances unless prescribed by a physician, taken in prescribed doses.

Defendant shall follow any, and all, recommendations by the Department regarding assessments and treatment, which may include AODA, Psychological, Sex Offender Treatment, and any cognitive intervention programming.

Defendant shall comply with the sex offender registry.

Writ of Habeas Corpus Ad Prosequendum and Order to Sheriff to transport defendant for his sentencing hearing on 01-13-17 at 11:00 a.m.
Copy filed.

Defendant in custody on WRIT.   
State moves to delete the penalty enhancer, repeater on count 1.   Motion granted.   Count 1 - 2nd degree sexual assault - Guilty plea.   Convicted.   State moves to dismiss and read in counts 2, 3, 4, & 5.   Motion granted.   
Court orders a pre-sentence investigation report to be completed by DOC.   Sentencing hearing is set for 01-13-17 at 10:00 a.m.  Report is due by 01-04-17.   
Defendant must submit DNA sample.

Jury trial on November 1, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Adjournment Order.

MOTION TO ADJOURN TRIAL - 
Attorney Vendetti just found out that Two Rivers PD sent the evidence to the crime lab for testing last week.  The lab will need about 2-3 more months to complete it.
The defendant objects to any adjournment.
The Court has heard nothing indicating the defendant would be at a disadvantage by moving the trial and grants the motion for adjournment.
The pretrial conference will still be held on 06-17-16 at 3:00 p.m. at which time Attorney Vendetti should know who the analyst is and will have their schedule.    The trial date will be set then.
